thread.title: Canes dealing with more injuries; will start Lack Tuesday
thread.title_full: Canes dealing with more injuries; will start Lack Tuesday

title: Canes dealing with more injuries; will start Lack Tuesday
text:
Canes dealing with more injuries; will start Lack Tuesday 
Posted 55 minutes ago Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this 37 Images 
Raleigh, N.C. â€” After getting off to an 0-2-0 start, the Carolina Hurricanes are already in catch-up mode and dealing with injuries. 
Defenseman James Wisniewski was lost for six months in the opener with a knee injury and now the Canes will now be without the services of center Riley Nash for up to two weeks with a shoulder injury. 
As a result, Elias Lindholm will slide to center on a line with Jeff Skinner and Chris Terry. 
On a positive note, Victor Rask, who left Saturday's game with Detroit with what appeared to be an upper body concern, practiced Monday and said he felt fine. 
The Canes will also make a change in net as Eddie Lack will make his Carolina debut Tuesday against Florida. Lack made three preseason starts for the Canes, recording a win and stopping 68 of 73 shots against. Before the start of the season, Carolina signed Lack to a 2-year, $5.5 million deal. 
The Canes will be in action Tuesday night at 7 p.m. at PNC Arena to play the Panthers who scored seven goals Saturday in their opening night win against Philadelphia. Credits
